recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans; line bottoms with parchment paper. Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla; beat until combined. Pour cake batter into the prepared pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the centers comes out clean, about 35 minutes. recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Prepare cakes: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) with racks in middle and lower third positions."},{"recipe_directions":"Place devil's food cake mix, 1 cup milk, 1/3 cup melted butter, 3 large eggs, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract in the bowl of a stand mixer. Beat at low speed, using the paddle attachment, for 1 minute until combined. Increase speed to medium and beat for 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Spoon batter evenly into 2 (9-inch) round nonstick cake pans, greased with baking spray; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Repeat procedure with the white cake mix, substituting 3 egg whites for 3 large eggs."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Bake 4 cakes in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted in middle comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes, rotating cake pans from front to back and between top and bottom racks halfway through baking time."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove pans to a wire rack and cool for 10 minutes. Remove cakes from pans and cool completely on wire racks, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Trim the top of the cakes as needed to make sure the top is level."},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare frosting: Beat softened butter with a stand mixer at medium speed, using the paddle attachment, until creamy, 1 to 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Add softened cream cheese and mix for 1 minute until combined, stopping to scrape down sides of bowl as needed."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk together powdered sugar and cocoa in a large bowl; gradually add to butter mixture alternately with 4 tablespoons milk, along with the vanilla. Beat at low speed until blended after each addition, stopping to scrape down bowl in between additions. (If needed, add up to 1 tablespoon milk, 1 teaspoon at a time, to reach desired consistency.) Increase speed to medium, and beat 1 to 2 minutes or until light and fluffy."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Assemble cake: Place 1 chocolate cake layer on a cutting board. Using a 6-inch round cutter, cut out center of cake to create a 6-inch cake round; leave 9-inch cake ring intact, and remove center 6-inch cake. Using a 3-inch round cutter, cut out center of the 6-inch cake to create a 3-inch cake round; leave 6-inch ring intact, and remove center 3-inch cake round. Place the 9-inch cake ring on a serving platter or cake stand. Set aside 6-inch ring and 3-inch cake round."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Repeat process with 1 vanilla cake layer to create 1 (9-inch) vanilla cake ring, 1 (6-inch) vanilla cake ring, and 1 (3-inch) vanilla cake round."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place the 6-inch vanilla ring in the center of the 9-inch chocolate ring. Place the 3-inch chocolate cake round in the center of the 6-inch vanilla ring."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Spread a thin layer of frosting over layer on platter. Place 9-inch vanilla cake ring on frosted layer and place the 6-inch chocolate ring in center of thee 9-inch vanilla ring. Place the 3-inch vanilla cake round in the center of the 6-inch chocolate ring. Spread a thin layer of frosting over layer. Repeat process with remaining chocolate cake layer and vanilla cake layer."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Spread remaining frosting over top and sides of cake. recipe_card: Chocolate Beet Cake with Beet-Vanilla Glaze
recipe_name: Chocolate Beet Cake with Beet-Vanilla Glaze
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"baking spray with flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¾ cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large eggs, separated, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup firmly packed brown sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup unsalted butter, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups pureed cooked beets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup buttermilk, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup powdered sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons pureed cooked beets"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 10 cup Bundt pan with a baking spray containing flour."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, and salt into a bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Separate eggs. Place egg whites into a bowl, and whip on high speed until stiff peaks form. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Cream together brown sugar, white sugar, butter, and oil in a large bowl with an electric mixer for 2 to 3 minutes. Add egg yolks and beat for another 3 minutes. Mix in beet puree and vanilla. Add in half of the sifted flour mixture, and mix until just combined. Pour in buttermilk and mix until just combined. Add in remaining flour mixture and mix until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips."},{"recipe_directions":"Add 1/3 of whipped egg whites to the cake batter, and gently fold to combine. Add in remaining egg whites, and gently fold just until no streaks of egg white remain. Pour batter into the prepared pan and gently smooth top into an even layer."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until top of cake springs back lightly when touched (or until a bamboo skewer inserted into the center of the cake comes out with a few moist crumbs), 50 to 55 minutes. Allow cake to cool in the pan for 20 minutes before gently running a knife around the edges of the cake to loosen. Invert cake onto a wire rack, and cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the glaze combine powdered sugar, heavy cream, beet puree, vanilla extract, and salt in a bowl. Whisk until smooth. If glaze is too thick, add more heavy cream; if glaze is too thin, add more powdered sugar until desired consistency is reached. Drizzle glaze over cooled cake."}]

Spray 3 (9-inch) round cake pans with baking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Combine chocolate morsels and hot coffee in a medium bowl; let stand for 2 minutes and then stir until chocolate is melted, 1 to 2 minutes. Trim cooled cakes flat, if necessary."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Beat powdered sugar, butter, and chestnut puree in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until filling is creamy, about 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place 1 cake layer on a cardboard round cut to the same size as cake. Smooth excess frosting flush with the sides of the cake. Refrigerate cake until chilled, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place chocolate in a 4-cup glass measuring cup with a spout for the glaze; set aside. Stir glaze with a spatula until completely smooth. Let stand at room temperature, stirring occasionally, until cooled to 100 to 105 degrees F (37 to 40 degrees C), 4 to 10 minutes. Glaze should be pourable and fluid."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Remove chilled cake from the refrigerator, and place on a wire rack or inverted bowl inside a rimmed baking sheet. Beat 6 egg yolks into the butter mixture, one at a time, beating well after each yolk is added. Beat the flour mixture into the butter mixture in thirds, alternating with milk. Mix in 3/4 teaspoon of grated lemon peel and 1 3/4 teaspoon of lemon juice."},{"recipe_directions":"With clean beaters, beat the egg whites to stiff peaks in a bowl; lightly fold the egg whites into the batter; use a rubber spatula or wire whisk to fold 1/3 of the beaten egg whites into the batter. Gently run the spatula through the center of the bowl, then around the sides of the bowl, repeating until fully incorporated. Add the remaining egg whites, folding just until incorporated.. Pour the batter into the 3 prepared cake pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cake comes out clean, 25 to 30 minutes. Allow cakes to cool in pans for 10 minutes; then turn out onto a rack to finish cooling."},{"recipe_directions":"To make filling, whisk 2 1/4 cup sugar, 2 tablespoons of grated lemon peel, 1/2 cup of lemon juice, 5 1/2 tablespoons of flour, and beaten egg together in a saucepan. Cook the mixture over low heat, whisking constantly, until the filling almost comes to a boil; cook until thickened and smooth, about 1 minute. Whisk in 2 tablespoons of butter until melted. Allow the filling to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"To assemble, place each cake layer down on a work surface, and place one hand lightly on the top of the cake. Use a serrated knife to slice the cake in half horizontally, with a light sawing motion, to create 2 layers from each cake (6 total layers). Brush crumbs from the layers. Place a cake layer onto a serving dish, and spread with 1/6 of the filling; repeat with all the layers and filling, ending with a layer of lemon filling for the top of the cake."}]

Remove pan from heat and allow mixture to sit at room temperature for about 30 minutes before placing into the refrigerator until chilled, about 30 minutes more."},{"recipe_directions":"When heavy cream mixture is chilled, finish the frosting. Mix in powdered sugar gradually, 1 cup at a time, mixing well after each addition."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove vanilla bean pod from chilled heavy cream. Discard vanilla bean pod. recipe_card: Prinsesstårta (Swedish Princess Cake)

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Prepare pastry cream: whisk sugar and cornstarch together in a medium saucepan. Gradually whisk in milk and egg yolks until combined. Turn to medium heat and cook, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens, 5 to 7 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove from heat and whisk in cold butter and vanilla until smooth. Strain through a fine mesh sieve into a large bowl. Place a piece of plastic wrap directly on top of custard and refrigerate until cold, about 3 hours or up to 24 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Coat two 8-inch round cake pans with baking spray and line the bottom of each pan with parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Bring a medium saucepan filled with 1 inch of water to a simmer over medium heat."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine eggs, egg yolks, and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer. Set the mixing bowl over the pot of simmering water. Cook, whisking constantly, until a thermometer reaches 110 degrees F (43 degrees C), 5 to 6 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Return bowl to the stand mixer. Beat with a whisk attachment on high speed until mixture is pale yellow and has tripled in volume, about 3 minutes. Fold in flour until just combined. Fold in melted butter and vanilla until combined. Divide batter evenly between the prepared pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean, 20 to 22 minutes. Let cool in pan 10 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack and let cool completely, about 1 hour. Use a long, serrated knife to split each cake layer in half horizontally. Set cake aside until pastry cream is ready to use."},{"recipe_directions":"Assemble cake: spread the cut side of each cake layer with warm raspberry jam. Place one cake layer, jam-side up, on a cake plate. Spread 1/2 cup pastry cream over cake. Repeat process with two more cake layers, ending with remaining cake layer on top, jam-side down. Place a 4-inch wooden skewer through the middle of the cake to hold layers in place. Reserve remaining remaining pastry cream for another use."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat heavy cream and 1/4 cup powdered sugar at medium-high speed with an electric mixer in a large bowl until stiff peaks form. Mound remaining whipped cream on top of cake, spreading to create a smooth dome."},{"recipe_directions":"Knead together marzipan and gel food dye until color is evenly distributed. Roll out marzipan in between 2 sheets of parchment paper, to a 15-inch circle; gently remove top piece of parchment paper. Invert marzipan and drape over cake; gently remove remaining parchment paper. Gently press marzipan down over cake, starting at the top of cake and working your way down to create a smooth dome. Cut away any excess and tuck ends of marzipan under cake."},{"recipe_directions":"Dust top of cake with sifted powdered sugar. Garnish with fresh raspberries."}]

recipe_card: Peanut Butter and Jelly Cake

Spray parchment with baking spray, then flour each parchment-lined pan, shaking away any excess flour."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk cake flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine sugar and butter in a large mixing bowl; beat with an electric mixer at medium speed until light and fluffy, 3 to 5 minutes. Add vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture, alternately with the milk, with the mixer running on low speed, beginning and ending with the flour."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites in a clean mixing bowl at medium speed until stiff peaks form. Gently fold egg whites into the batter. Slice each cake in half horizontally to yield 4 slices."},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare the filling: beat peanut butter, cream cheese, honey, butter, and salt together at medium speed until smooth. The peanut butter mixture should be loose enough to be spreadable."},{"recipe_directions":"Place jelly in a small mixing bowl and whisk to loosen."},{"recipe_directions":"Carefully transfer one cake layer to a cake plate or serving platter. For Bunt cakes, allow the cake to cool in the pan for 10 minutes before inverting onto a wire rack."}]

recipe_card: Quick Dobos Torte with Coffee Cream
recipe_name: Quick Dobos Torte with Coffee Cream
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (12 ounce) packages frozen pound cakes, thawed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 ⅓ cups water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon instant coffee granules"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon quick-mixing flour (such as Wondra®), or more as needed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 sticks unsalted butter, cut into pieces"},{"recipe_ingredients":"10 ounces frozen whipped topping (such as Cool Whip®), thawed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Carefully slice each thawed pound cake into 6 to 8 horizontal even layers."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine water, sugar, vanilla extract, and instant coffee in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a soft, slow, consistent boil with small bubbles. Stir frequently and cook until mixture starts to have a foamy look, about 1 hour."},{"recipe_directions":"When cream starts to rise, continue stirring gently. If foam continues and does not settle by stirring, sprinkle with flour while stirring constantly, and allow to cook for about 5 more minutes. Coffee mixture should be a little syrupy and slightly caramelized. Don't overcook at this point once you reach the slightly syrupy stage or it will revert to a liquidy gritty texture which is undesirable to the final result of a fluffy cream."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove from heat. Stir butter pieces into the coffee mixture until melted. Transfer to the refrigerator to cool down."},{"recipe_directions":"Once cream is cooled, beat with an electric mixer until stiff and fluffy. Gently fold in whipped topping. Refrigerate for 2 more hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Set the first layer on a cake platter and spread coffee cream in a thin layer on top. Add the 2nd cake layer and frost. Continue putting the torte together, sticking the individual layers together with coffee cream. Frost torte on the top and on the sides as well."}]

recipe_card: Raspberry Walnut Torte 30 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¾ cups cake flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup ground walnuts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3  eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ½ cups heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (12 ounce) jar raspberry preserves"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9 inch pans. In a medium bowl mix together the flour, baking powder, 1/2 teaspoon salt and ground walnuts. Set aside. In a small bowl whip 1 1/2 cups cream until stiff peaks form. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In a large bowl combine 1 1/2 cups sugar, eggs and 3 teaspoons vanilla. Beat 5 minutes at highest speed of an electric mixer. fold in flour mixture alternately with whipped cream."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour batter into prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 15 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack and cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the Frosting: In a large bowl combine cream cheese, 1 cup sugar 1/8 teaspoon salt and 1 teaspoon vanilla. Beat until smooth. In a separate small bowl, whip 1/12 cups whipping cream until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream into cream cheese mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"To assemble cake: Split each layer in half horizontally to form 4 layers. Place 1 layer on serving plate; spread with 1/2 cup frosting. Top with second layer; spread with 1/2 cup preserves. Top with 3rd layer; spread with 1/2 cup frosting. Top with remaining cake layer. Frost sides of cake with frosting, reserving about 1 cup for decorating. Spread remaining preserves on top of cake. Using a pastry bag and a star tip, pipe reserved frosting in a lattice design on the top of cake, pipe border around top and bottom edges of cake. Store in refrigerator."}]

recipe_card: Ukrainian Prune Torte 5 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup confectioners' sugar, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon almond extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup blanched almonds"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups sifted all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"16 ounces pitted prunes"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon lemon juice"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 5 (8 inch) round pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Grind the blanched almonds in a food processor with 1/4 cup confectioners' sugar. Cream the butter with the remaining 3/4 cup confectioners' sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the egg. Stir in the almond extract, salt, and ground almond mixture. Add the flour and mix thoroughly. Divide the dough into 5 equal parts. Roll each piece between 2 sheets of waxed paper or parchment paper to fit the pans, or pat each piece of dough into the prepared pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the edges begin to brown, about 20 minutes. Remove from the pans while still hot."},{"recipe_directions":"To make the Prune Filling: Place the prunes in a saucepan with the water. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and let stand for 10 minutes. Drain and reserve the liquid. Puree the prunes in a food processor."},{"recipe_directions":"Return the prune puree to the saucepan and add the white sugar, cinnamon, lemon juice and 4 tablespoons reserved prune liquid. Bring the mixture to a boil, then remove from heat. Assemble the torte layers, spreading them with warm prune filling. Let stand for 24 hours before slicing."}]

recipe_card: Black Forest Cake II 183 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8 inch round pans with parchment paper circles. Sift together flour, cocoa, baking soda and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and vanilla. Beat in flour mixture, alternating with buttermilk, until combined. Pour into 2 round 8 inch pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 35 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the cake comes out clean. Cool completely. recipe_card: Hungarian Chestnut Cake 6 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottom of a greased 9-inch springform pan with parchment paper. Then grease the parchment paper."},{"recipe_directions":"Separate the eggs."},{"recipe_directions":"In a food processor puree the chestnuts with the butter and the rum, scraping down the sides, until the mixture is smooth. Add the melted bittersweet chocolate and blend the mixture until it is combined well. With the motor running, add the yolks, 1 at a time, and transfer the mixture to a large bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"In a bowl with an electric mixer beat the whites with the salt until they hold soft peaks, add the sugar, a little at a time, beating, and beat the meringue until it holds stiff peaks."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk about one fourth of the meringue into the chocolate mixture to lighten it and fold in the remaining meringue gently but thoroughly. Remove the bottom of the pan, invert the torte onto a rack, and let it cool completely. (The cake will fall as it cools.)"},{"recipe_directions":"To Make Glaze: Put 6 ounces of the finely chopped chocolate in a small bowl, in a saucepan bring 1/2 cup of the cream to a boil, and pour it over the chocolate. Stir the mixture until the chocolate is melted and the glaze is smooth and stir in 1 tablespoon of the rum. Dip each candied chestnut halfway into the glaze to coat it partially, transfer the chestnuts to a foil-covered tray, and let them set."},{"recipe_directions":"Invert the cake onto a rack set on wax paper, pour the glaze over it, smoothing the glaze with a spatula and letting the excess drip down the side, and let the cake stand for 2 hours, or until the glaze is set. recipe_card: Pumpkin Torte II 28 Ratings

recipe_card: No Bake Lime Mousse Torte 79 Ratings

Mix the gelatin into the warmed chocolate until melted; set aside to cool to room temperature. recipe_card: Käsesahnetorte (German Yogurt Mousse Cake) 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large eggs, separated, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons warm water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 ½ ounces cake flour, sifted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅓ cup cold water"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (.25 ounce) package unflavored gelatin"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups Greek yogurt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup confectioners' sugar, or as needed"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Place a large piece of parchment paper over the bottom of a 9-inch springform pan. Make sure it is taught, then clip on the rim and cut off the excess parchment paper. Grease the sides."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg yolks, warm water, and sugar for sponge base in a bowl with an electric mixer until pale and fluffy. Mix in vanilla extract."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix cake flour and baking powder together in a separate bowl. Sift over egg yolk mixture and fold in thoroughly until no lumps remain."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg whites and salt in a glass, metal, or ceramic bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold into the sponge batter using a spatula. Pour into the prepared pan and even out the surface with a spatula or a large knife."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick comes out clean, about 15 minutes. Let cool in the pan for a few minutes, then remove sponge cake from the pan and carefully peel off parchment. Cool on a wire rack."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip heavy cream for filling in a bowl with an electric mixer until stiff. Refrigerate."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour water into a small heat-proof bowl and sprinkle gelatin over top. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat Greek yogurt, sugar, and lemon juice in a separate bowl with an electric mixer until sugar is fully dissolved."},{"recipe_directions":"Add water to a small saucepan to a 1-inch depth. Place over medium-high heat and bring to a simmer. Lower the bowl with the gelatin into the water, making sure no water spills into it. Stir until the gelatin is liquid and fully dissolved. Remove the bowl with the gelatin with kitchen tongs."},{"recipe_directions":"Add 1 tablespoon of the yogurt mixture immediately to the gelatin and stir until completely incorporated. Add 4 to 5 more tablespoons the same way until the gelatin mix is cooled; it should be smooth and not contain any lumps. Transfer the gelatin mixture into the yogurt mixture and beat with an electric mixer until well blended."},{"recipe_directions":"Fold whipped cream into the yogurt mixture until well blended. You may also give it a quick whisk with an electric mixer to blend the two, as long as you don't overmix."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut the sponge cake horizontally into 2 equally thick layers. Grease the sides of the springform pan and place the bottom sponge cake back into it. If the sponge shrunk during baking, push it down gently so it completely fills the pan. Pour the filling into the pan and even it out with a knife or a spatula. Place the second layer on top, with the cut side down. Cover and refrigerate until set, at least 4 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove cake from the refrigerator. Dip a large knife in cold water and run it all around the filling to loosen. Carefully remove the rim. Dust with confectioners' sugar just before serving."}]

recipe_card: Streamline Hungarian Torte 12 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups chopped walnuts"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (.25 ounce) envelope active dry yeast"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg yolks"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ⅓ cups butter or margarine, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 ½ cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (16 ounce) jar apricot preserves"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup white sugar"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 11x17 inch jelly roll pan. Mix together the walnuts, ground cinnamon, and 3/4 cup of sugar in a medium bowl and set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"In a small bowl, dissolve the yeast and 1 teaspoon sugar in warm water. Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes. In a large bowl, stir together the yeast mixture, egg yolks, sour cream, and butter. Gradually stir in the flour until the dough becomes too stiff to use a spoon. Use your hand to knead the dough in the bowl until it becomes smooth, about 5 minutes. Divide the dough into three equal parts, form into balls, cover, and set aside to rest for about 15 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll one of the balls of dough between 2 sheets of waxed paper to fit the pan. Place the dough in the bottom of the prepared baking pan and spread with 3/4 of the nut mixture. Roll out another ball of dough in the same way, place this over the nut layer in the pan and spread the apricot preserves evenly over the dough. Roll the third ball in the same way and place on top of the layer of preserves."},{"recipe_directions":"Place the torte in the preheated oven and set the timer for 40 minutes. When the timer goes off, the top of the torte should be golden brown, if not then wait a few minutes. Place the egg whites into a clean glass or metal bowl. Whip the egg whites to soft peaks, then gradually add 2/3 cup sugar while beating the egg whites to stiff peaks. Spread the meringue evenly over the top of the torte and sprinkle with the remaining nut mixture."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake the meringue-covered torte for an additional 15 minutes. Cool the torte in the pan set on a wire rack. Trim the edges for a cleaner presentation. Serve at room temperature."}]

recipe_card: French Chocolate Cake 57 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"10 (1 ounce) squares semi-sweet chocolate"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup unsalted butter, cubed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5  eggs, separated"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup sifted all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 dash cream of tartar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"salt to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ tablespoon confectioners' sugar, for dusting"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Generously grease a 9-inch springform cake tin. Dust with a little sugar, and tap out excess."},{"recipe_directions":"Set aside 3 tablespoons of sugar. Place chocolate, butter, and remaining sugar in a large, heavy-based pan. Cook over moderate heat until chocolate and butter have melted, and sugar has dissolved. Remove the pan from heat. Stir in vanilla, and leave mixture to cool slightly."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat egg yolks into chocolate mixture one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in flour."},{"recipe_directions":"In a scrupulously clean, grease-free, and large bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Add cream of tartar and salt, and beat to stiff peaks. Sprinkle reserved sugar over egg whites, and beat until stiff and glossy. Use a whisk or spatula to fold 1/3 of egg whites into chocolate mixture, then carefully fold in remaining whites. Carefully pour batter into the prepared tin, and tap the tin gently to release air bubbles."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake until well risen and a skewer inserted into center of the cake comes out clean, for about 45 minutes to 1 hour. Transfer cake to a wire cooling rack, and remove the sides of the springform tin. Cool completely, and then remove the base. Do not attempt to remove cake before it's completely cooled as this cake is very fragile."}]

recipe_card: Sacher Torte 15 Ratings

recipe_card: Doberge Cake 33 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"4  eggs, separated"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ½ cups sifted cake flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup butter, room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup milk, room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white sugar, divided"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup unsweetened cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (1 ounce) squares bittersweet chocolate, chopped"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4  large eggs, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups whole milk"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon butter, room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 cups confectioners' sugar, sifted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder, sifted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon hot water (Optional)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups semisweet chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups heavy whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 3 9-inch cake pans."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat whites of 4 eggs in a glass or metal bowl until foamy. Continue to beat until stiff peaks form. Lift your beater or whisk straight up: the tip of the peak formed by the egg whites should curl over slightly. Set aside. Reserve egg yolks in a small bowl. Sift together cake flour and baking powder in a separate bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat 3/4 cup butter, 2 cups sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy. The mixture should be noticeably lighter in color. Add reserved egg yolks one at a time, allowing each yolk to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next. Pour in cake flour mixture alternately with 1 cup milk, mixing until just incorporated. Stir lemon juice and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract into batter."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk beaten egg whites a few times; use a whisk or rubber spatula to fold 1/3 of the egg white mixture into the batter to lighten it. Fold in remaining egg whites, mixing just until combined. Pour batter into prepared pans and spread evenly over bottom."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in preheated oven until cake is light golden brown and just pulling from the sides of the pan, 15 to 20 minutes. Do not overbake. Cool in pans for 5 minutes, then invert onto cooling racks to cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"To make custard: combine 1 1/2 cups sugar, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/4 cup flour, cornstarch, and 1/4 cup cocoa powder in a saucepan and mix well. In a separate bowl, whisk remaining 1/2 cup sugar into 4 beaten eggs. Pour 4 cups whole milk into saucepan and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture begins to boil. Remove from heat and gradually pour hot milk mixture into egg mixture, whisking constantly. Add chopped chocolate and stir until chocolate melts."},{"recipe_directions":"Return custard to saucepan and cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until mixture has thickened, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in 1 tablespoon butter and 1 tablespoon vanilla extract. Transfer custard to a bowl and allow to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"To make buttercream: place 1 cup softened butter in a mixing bowl. Gradually beat in 3 cups sifted confectioners' sugar. Beat in 1 cup sifted cocoa powder. Mix in 1 teaspoon vanilla extract to make a smooth frosting. If the frosting is too stiff, add a tablespoon of hot water or as needed, drizzling it very slowly, and mix well until desired consistency is reached."},{"recipe_directions":"To make ganache: place chocolate chips in a large mixing bowl. Heat heavy cream in a saucepan until very hot but not boiling. Remove from heat and pour over the chocolate chips. Let stand for 3 minutes, then whisk, scraping sides and bottom of the bowl, until smooth. Stir in 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. Allow to cool to room temperature, cover, and set aside. Ganache should be spreadable and not firm."},{"recipe_directions":"To assemble cake: using a long serrated knife and a gentle sawing motion, slice each cake layer in half horizontally. Cover cake plate with strips of parchment paper or foil for easier clean up. Put a dab of buttercream in the center of the plate to keep cake from shifting. Set a cake half on the plate."},{"recipe_directions":"Spread custard filling onto cake layer, taking care not to spread it too close to the edge (weight of the cake layers will cause it to spread out). Gently lay another cake round on top of the first and repeat with another custard layer. Repeat with remaining layers and custard, topping custard with the last cake layer. Chill cake for 30 minutes to allow it to firm up."},{"recipe_directions":"Frost top and sides of cake with chocolate buttercream. Chill for 30 minutes, to firm and set."},{"recipe_directions":"Spread frosted cake with ganache. Remove parchment strips or aluminum foil from cake plate. Store cake in the refrigerator."}]

recipe_card: Galette des Rois 52 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup almond paste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 tablespoons unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large egg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon almond extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (17.25 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  dry kidney bean"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  egg, beaten"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar for dusting"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"To make the frangipane filling: Place almond paste into a food processor or blender with about half of the sugar, and process until well blended. Add butter and remaining sugar and process until smooth; blend in 1 egg, vanilla extract, almond extract, flour and salt. Set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Roll out one sheet of puff pastry into an 11-inch square. Keep pastry cool, trying not to knead or stretch it. Use a large pie plate, cake pan, or skillet to trace an 11-inch circle onto the dough using the tip of a small knife. Place the circle of pastry onto the prepared baking sheet. Repeat with the second sheet of pastry; place on a plate. Refrigerate both sheets."},{"recipe_directions":"Mound almond frangipane filling onto the center of the pastry that is on the baking sheet. Leave about 1 1/2 inch margin at the edges. Press the bean or fève down into the filling. Place the second sheet of pastry on top, and press down the edges to seal. Beat the remaining egg with a fork, and lightly brush onto the top of the galette. Use a knife to make a crisscross pattern in the egg wash, and then prick several small slits in the top to vent steam while baking."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Do not open the oven until the time is up, as the pastry will not fully puff. Remove from the oven, and dust with confectioners' sugar. Return to the oven, and cook for an additional 12 to 15 minutes, or until the top is a deep golden brown. Transfer to a wire rack to cool."},{"recipe_directions":"Lay a golden paper crown gently on top of the cake. This will be used to crown the person who finds the bean or fève. Serve warm or cold."}]

recipe_card: Dobos Torte 33 Ratings

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (205 degrees C). Have ready two 10-inch cardboard circles. Generously grease a 9-inch springform pan with soft butter, and dust with flour."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat the egg whites until frothy, and gradually add 1 cup sugar. Beat just to soft peaks. In another bowl, beat the yolks with the milk, lemon peel, vanilla, and salt. Fold this into the egg whites. Sift the flour over the egg mixture, and fold in."},{"recipe_directions":"Spread 1 1/3 cups batter into the prepared pan. Bake for about 5 to 9 minutes, or until small, brown spots begin to appear on cake. Remove the cake from the oven, and remove layer from pan with a spatula. Dust the cake lightly with flour, and place on a rack to cool. Grease pan again, and repeat this process until all of the batter is used, about 6 times more. Place the layers between wax paper, and cover with a towel. Chill layers for a few hours. Make the Chocolate Buttercream."},{"recipe_directions":"Layer the chilled layers on one of the cardboard rounds with the buttercream. Start with one layer; cover with the buttercream, and then press down with another layer to make a good seal. Repeat this with the remaining layers, but reserve one layer. Wrap the cake in plastic, and chill for at least 6 hours along with the remaining buttercream. Grease the other cardboard round with the shortening, and place the last layer on it."},{"recipe_directions":"Place 1 cup sugar into a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Allow sugar to cook until the edges look melted and brown. Begin stirring with a wooden spoon. Cook until the sugar become an amber color, and is smooth. Carefully pour the caramel over the top of the last layer, and spread to the edges with an oiled knife. Quickly, using an oiled knife, indent the top of the caramel into 16 wedges. Allow to cool slightly, and then retouch the indents with the knife again. Place layer onto a counter top dusted with sugar, and allow the caramel to cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"Place some more buttercream on top of the chilled torte, and top with the caramel round. Frost the sides with the remaining buttercream. Chill the torte before serving."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"On the first day, combine candied orange peel, candied citron, candied pineapple, red and green candied cherries, currants, raisins, walnuts, and almonds. Combine orange juice and 2/3 cup bourbon; pour over fruit and nuts. Stir and then cover tightly. Let fruit marinate in a cool place for a full day, or at least 20 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"On the second day, line two 9x5-inch loaf pans with parchment paper or aluminum foil and grease the inside with cooking spray. Combine flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, allspice, ginger, cocoa, baking powder, and salt in a large bowl and stir with a whisk to blend."},{"recipe_directions":"In a separate large bowl, beat butter, brown sugar, and white sugar until light and fluffy using an electric mixer. Stir in egg yolks until blended and then mix in applesauce, 1/2 cup bourbon, and vanilla until fluffy. Continue stirring, and add flour mixture gradually until well combined. Add molasses and stir to combine. When batter is thoroughly mixed, gently mix in fruit and nut mixture with all of its juices."},{"recipe_directions":"In a separate bowl, whip egg whites with an electric mixer until they can hold a stiff peak. Fold egg whites into batter. Divide evenly between the prepared pans. Cover loosely with a towel and let batter stand 8 hours to overnight in a cool, dry place."},{"recipe_directions":"On the third day, preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C). Place a large baking pan on the bottom shelf and pour boiling water into it until almost full. Place a baking sheet on the center shelf and place fruit cakes on the baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake for 2 1/2 hours in the preheated oven. Check water level and refill if needed. Cover cakes with a sheet of parchment paper, taking care not to let it touch the shelf. Continue to bake until a knife or toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour more. Cool fruitcakes in the pans, and set over a wire rack. Once cool, remove cakes from the pans, and leave the parchment paper on. Sprinkle with more bourbon if desired and wrap in aluminum foil. Place in a tin or other sealed container and let sit 8 hours to overnight before serving."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Lightly spray a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray. Transfer to a wire rack and let cool for 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare the Filling: Beat cream cheese with a stand mixer fitted with a paddle attachment on medium speed until creamy and smooth, about 2 minutes. Pour filling into the cooled crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Place springform pan in a large roasting pan. Add hot water to roasting pan to reach halfway up sides of springform pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Return to the preheated oven and bake until the center is almost set but still slightly wobbly, 55 to 60 minutes. Remove foil from outside of the pan, and cool cheesecake to room temperature, about 1 hour. Cover with plastic wrap and transfer to the refrigerator to chill completely, at least 8 or up to 24 hours."},{"recipe_directions":"Dotdash Meredith Food Studios"},{"recipe_directions":"Prepare Ganache: Place chocolate chips in a medium heat-proof bowl. Heat cream in a small saucepan over medium until steaming, then pour over the chocolate. Let stand for 1 minute, then whisk until chocolate is melted and smooth. Add ube extract and whisk to combine. recipe_card: Chocolate Pistachio Cheesecake 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"3 ounces chocolate wafer cookies"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup raw unsalted pistachios, divided, plus more for garnish"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons butter, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 (8 ounce) packages reduced-fat cream cheese (Neufchâtel), softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1  avocado, peeled, seeded, and mashed until smooth (1/2 cup)"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups fat-free plain Greek-style yogurt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons cornstarch"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup granulated sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large egg whites"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon almond extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅛ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ cup whipping cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons powdered sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (16 ounce) container frozen nondairy low-fat whipped topping, thawed, plus more for garnish"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Coat a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray."},{"recipe_directions":"In a food processor, pulse cookies, 1/4 cup pistachios, and 2 tablespoons sugar until mostly finely ground. (It's OK to leave some texture.) Add melted butter; pulse to combine. Spread mixture evenly in the prepared pan and press firmly into bottom of pan."},{"recipe_directions":"For pistachio butter, blend remaining 1/2 cup pistachios in a small food processor until very smooth and slightly loose consistency, about 5 minutes. Transfer pistachio butter to a large bowl; add cream cheese, avocado, 1 cup yogurt, cornstarch, and 3/4 cup white sugar. Beat with an electric mixer at medium speed just until mixture is nearly smooth. Add egg whites, almond extract, and a pinch of salt; beat until just combined. Spread over prepared crust."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake until surface near edges appears set when gently wiggled, about 40 minutes. Turn off oven. Let cheesecake stand in oven 30 minutes. Cool in pan on wire rack 15 minutes. Using a thin metal spatula, loosen cheesecake from sides of pan. Cool completely."},{"recipe_directions":"For mousse, beat whipping cream, powdered sugar, vanilla, remaining 1 cup yogurt and a pinch salt in a bowl with an electric mixer at medium-low speed until fluffy, about 4 minutes. Spread over cheesecake."},{"recipe_directions":"Spread whipped topping over mousse. Chill, covered, at least 4 hours or up to 5 days. To serve, remove from pan, slice, and garnish with additional whipped topping and pistachios."}]

recipe_card: Air Fryer Turtle Cheesecake 2 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup graham cracker crumbs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"6 tablespoons butter, melted"},{"recipe_ingredients":"12 ounces cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/3 cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/3 cup sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon lemon juice"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pinch salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chocolate ice cream topping, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons caramel ice cream topping, or to taste"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons chopped toasted pecans, or to taste"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Line the bottom of a 7- to 7 1/2-inch springform pan or cake pan with parchment paper. Stir together graham crackers and 1 tablespoon sugar in a bowl. Stir in melted butter. Beat with an electric mixer at medium-high speed until smooth. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating at low speed just until combined. Pour filling over the crust. recipe_card: Red, White, and Blue Cheesecake Bites 3 Ratings
recipe_name: Red, White, and Blue Cheesecake Bites
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup finely crushed graham cracker crumbs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons melted butter"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/8 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 pound cream cheese, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 lime, zested"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 cup cold heavy cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"24 slices fresh strawberry"},{"recipe_ingredients":"72 fresh blueberries"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Spray 2 12-cup mini muffin tins with nonstick cooking spray, and use your finger to make sure the inside of each cup is well greased. Place muffin tins on a sheet pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir together graham cracker crumbs, 1 tablespoon sugar, butter, and 1/8 teaspoon vanilla extract in a bowl until crumb mixture resembles wet sand. Spoon a slightly rounded teaspoon of crumb mixture into the bottom of each cup. Use a spoon to spread crumbs into a relatively even layer."},{"recipe_directions":"Set one muffin pan on top of the other and press lightly to compact the crumbs. Repeat with the other pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine softened cream cheese, lime zest, and 1/2 cup sugar in a bowl, and beat until light and fluffy with an electric mixer or whisk. Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, flour, and 1 egg; beat until egg is incorporated and mixture is smooth. Add remaining egg; whisk until smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Transfer batter into a piping bag, and pipe into the muffin tins, filling them all the way to the top. You can use a spoon; but a piping bag is neater and takes much less time. Use a skewer to stir each cup to remove any air bubbles. Tap pan on the counter to settle batter down."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until batter rises slightly and very small cracks appear on the surface, 20 to 25 minutes. The cheesecakes on the inside may cook more slowly than the ones on the outside, and may not rise as high or crack."},{"recipe_directions":"Let cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes. Remove from the tins. Wrap and refrigerate cheesecakes until fully chilled, at least 30 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"To make whipped cream topping, whisk cold cream in a bowl until soft peaks start to form. Add sour cream, and continue whisking until medium-stiff peaks form. Top each cold cheesecake with whipped cream, 3 blueberries, and 1 strawberry slice."},{"recipe_directions":"Chef John"}]

recipe_card: Butternut Squash Cheesecake 1 Rating
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 large butternut squash, roasted to yield 1 1/2 cups mashed squash"},{"recipe_ingredients":"16 ounces cream cheese, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3/4 cup white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 teaspoon kosher salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 cup maple syrup"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/2 teaspoon ground ginger"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1/4 teaspoon freshly grated nutmeg"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"5 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup heavy cream"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Oil a 10-inch springform pan, line with parchment, and set aside. Line a baking sheet with parchment."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut butternut squash into thick crosswise slices, remove seeds, and place on the lined baking sheet."},{"recipe_directions":"Roast in the preheated oven until very soft, about 1 hour. When cool enough to handle, separate the flesh from the skin; discard skin. Mash squash until smooth, measure out 1 1/2 cups, and set aside to cool completely. Reserve any remaining squash for another use."},{"recipe_directions":"Increase the oven temperature to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Add softened cream cheese, sugar, flour, and salt to a bowl, and cream together with a spatula until very smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Add maple syrup, 1 1/2 cups mashed butternut squash, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg. Mix with an electric mixer or whisk until combined; mix in vanilla. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in cream."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour batter into prepared springform pan. Tap the pan lightly on the counter to settle the batter."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until cheesecake is almost fully set, 50 to 60 minutes. The center should wiggle very slightly If the pan is shaken back and forth. If the center seems soupy, continue baking for a few more minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove and let cool for 5 minutes. Run a thin knife between the outside edge of the cheesecake and the inside of the springform ring to release cheesecake from the ring; it will contract as it cools. Let cool 30 minutes more, then remove outside ring."},{"recipe_directions":"Refrigerate cheesecake for a few hours or up to overnight before serving."},{"recipe_directions":"Chef Mo"},{"recipe_directions":"This is a fast and hot baking method, which will result in surface cracks once the cheesecake cools. If you don’t want cracks, use the more traditional low and slow method: Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) with the pan placed in a water bath until just set. Open the oven door to release heat, and then let cheesecake cool slowly in the oven with the door cracked open."}]

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Day One: Place starter into a large glass jar or bowl. Strain peach juice over starter. Cut each peach slice into 4 pieces and add to starter-juice mixture. A pan of water underneath the jar will keep ants out."},{"recipe_directions":"Day Ten: Strain pineapple juice over starter mixture. Cut each pineapple in half and add to starter mixture. recipe_card: Toasted Angel Food Cake with Strawberries

recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)."},{"recipe_directions":"Place 1 3/4 cups sugar in a food processor and blend until superfine, about 2 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift half the fine sugar, cake flour, and salt together in a bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Whisk egg whites, water, cream of tartar, and lemon extract together in a large bowl for 2 minutes. Spoon batter carefully into an ungreased fluted tube pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 35 minutes. Invert onto a cooling rack and let cool completely, at least 25 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Beat cream cheese and 1/4 cup butter together in a bowl using an electric mixer on medium speed until light and creamy. Add lemon juice; beat until just blended. Gradually mix in all but 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar on low speed until frosting is just blended. Stir in lemon zest."},{"recipe_directions":"Mix 3/4 cup strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, and raspberries thoroughly in a bowl with 2 tablespoons white sugar."},{"recipe_directions":"Cut a curved, smile-shaped line near the bottom of each whole strawberry; carefully cut another, flatter curve above. Leave room above the smile and below the leaves for eyeballs."},{"recipe_directions":"Place reserved 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar in a small bowl. Dust hands with sugar and roll a tiny amount of stiff decorator icing between your fingers into a small ball. Place it on the strawberry, above the smile. Make another ball and stick it next to the first one. Stick 1 black sugar pearl onto each frosting ball to create eyes. Repeat with remaining whole strawberries."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove cake carefully from the pan, scraping edges from side if needed. Slice into 6 slices about 2 inches thick. Spread 2 tablespoons butter equally on the outside of the slices."},{"recipe_directions":"Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Fill each prepared muffin cup with 1/4 cup batter"},{"recipe_directions":"Bake until a toothpick inserted in centers comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool in pan on a wire rack 5 minutes. Transfer to wire rack to cool completely, about 20 minutes."},{"recipe_directions":"Meanwhile, beat together cream cheese and butter in a large bowl with an electric mixer at medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 30 seconds. Reduce speed to low; add powdered sugar, 1 cup at a time, beating until frosting is smooth."},{"recipe_directions":"Fit a piping bag with a large star or round tip and fill with frosting. Pipe frosting onto cupcakes. Garnish with pomegranate arils. Serve immediately or store, chilled, in an airtight container up to 1 week."}]

recipe_card: Chocolate Chip Bundt® Cake 8 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup margarine"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"⅔ cup cocoa powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup white chocolate chips"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¾ cup dark chocolate chips"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Grease and flour a 12-cup fluted tube pan (such as Bundt®)."},{"recipe_directions":"Whip sugar and margarine together in a large bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating briefly after each addition. Mix in sour cream and vanilla extract."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift flour, baking soda, and baking powder together in a separate bowl. Add flour mixture in 4 batches, beating batter thoroughly after each addition."},{"recipe_directions":"Remove about 2 1/2 cups batter to a small bowl and add cocoa powder. Stir until dark in color. Stir in white chocolate chips."},{"recipe_directions":"Stir dark chocolate chips into the light-colored batter. Layer the 2 batters, starting with the light-colored batter, into the prepared Bundt® pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until the top is golden brown and a knife inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour 20 minutes. Cool on a wire rack for 20 minutes. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen. Invert carefully onto a serving plate or cooling rack."}]

recipe_card: Best Ever Cinnamon Bundt Cake 4 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"1 ¼ cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"4 tablespoons vegetable oil"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large eggs, at room temperature"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons vanilla extract"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 tablespoons all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 tablespoon ground cinnamon"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 teaspoons baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ cup buttermilk, at room temperature"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Brush a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt) with a little butter and dust with some flour."},{"recipe_directions":"Cream sugar, butter, and oil together in a bowl until well combined. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Mix in vanilla extract."},{"recipe_directions":"Sift 2 cups plus 2 tablespoons flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl. Fold 1/3 of the flour mixture gently into the butter mixture with a spatula. Mix in 1/2 of the buttermilk. Repeat once more, then mix in remaining flour until just combined. Avoid overmixing. Pour batter into the prepared pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 45 minutes. Allow cake to cool in the pan for 15 minutes before inverting onto a cooling rack to cool completely."}]

Grease a fluted tube pan (such as Bundt®) and dust with flour."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large bowl."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine bananas, oil, soy milk, and vanilla extract in a second bowl. Add flaxseed mixture and stir to combine. Fold in flour mixture in batches, but do not overmix. Fold in nuts and raisins. Fill batter into the prepared baking pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick comes out clean, 40 to 50 minutes."}]

recipe_card: Apricot Jam Cake 3 Ratings
recipe_ingredients: [{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups all-purpose flour"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon baking powder"},{"recipe_ingredients":"½ teaspoon baking soda"},{"recipe_ingredients":"¼ teaspoon salt"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup unsalted butter, softened"},{"recipe_ingredients":"2 cups white sugar"},{"recipe_ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 cup sour cream"},{"recipe_ingredients":"1 (12 ounce) jar apricot preserves"}]
recipe_directions: [{"recipe_directions":"Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 12-cup fluted tube pan."},{"recipe_directions":"Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl; set aside."},{"recipe_directions":"Cream butter in a mixing bowl with an electric mixer. Gradually add sugar and beat until light and fluffy, 5 to 7 minutes. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add flour mixture in 3 batches, alternating with sour cream, beating batter briefly on low after each addition."},{"recipe_directions":"Pour 1/2 of the batter into the prepared pan and spoon 1/2 of the apricot preserves on top, spreading it to within 1/2 inch of the edges. Repeat with remaining batter and preserves."},{"recipe_directions":"Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 55 to 60 minutes. Cool in the pan for 15 minutes. Run a table knife around the edges to loosen. Invert carefully onto a serving platter."}]
